item.title: Guy add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "A man may be very industrious, and yet not spend his time well. There is no more fatal blunderer than he who consumes the greater part of life getting his living." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Guy add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Guy add a quote by Paul Dudley White
item.description: "A vigorous five-mile walk will do more good for an unhappy but otherwise healthy adult than all the medicine and psychology in the world." -- Paul Dudley White

item.title: Guy add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
